meanings.definition: Establish (a position) so firmly that change is very difficult.
meanings.sent1: The community worked together to intrench their values in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: It is important to intrench good habits early in life.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn old man intrenched himself in his ways, refusing to try anything new.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was intrenched in her heart, impossible to shake.
meanings.sent5: The castle walls intrench the kingdom, protecting it from invaders.

meanings.definition: Dig or excavate a trench or trenches.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers intrench the battlefield for protection.
meanings.sent2: Farmers intrench the fields to prevent flooding.
meanings.sent3: The kids intrenched a moat around their sandcastle, pretending it was a fortress.
meanings.sent4: The roots of the tree intrench deep into the ground, seeking water.
meanings.sent5: The construction workers intrench the area before laying the foundation for the building.
